      Marks the SqmFrom as being "used" in the from-clause, although that really indicates that it was defined/created in the from-clause too

      todo (6.0) : figure out how to best handle calling this -> is it enough to do it just for the actually selected NavigableReference? or should it be set for any of the "intermediate" NavigableReferences (joins) too? select o.customer from Order o select o.customer.shippingAddress from Order o In the first, clearly `o.customer` is "used in the select".

      • getIntrinsicSubclassIndicator

        public ManagedTypeDescriptor getIntrinsicSubclassIndicator()
        Description copied from interface: UsageDetails
        An intrinsic subclass indicator is given when the SqmFrom is defined in the from-clause. E.g.: select c from Order o join treat( o.customer as ApacCustomer ) c here, the intrinsic subclass indicator for the `o.customer` join would be the `ApacCustomer` subclass of `Customer`
        Specified by:
        getIntrinsicSubclassIndicator in interface UsageDetails

      • getIncidentalSubclassIndicators

        public Collection<ManagedTypeDescriptor> getIncidentalSubclassIndicators()
        Description copied from interface: UsageDetails
        An incidental subclass indicator is given when the SqmFrom is downcast when referenced outside the from-clause. E.g. select treat( o.customer as ApacCustomer ).someApacSpecificDetail from Order o todo (6.0) : another way to look at this is that this particular example also illustrates an intrinsic subclass indicator Maybe the keeping the combo of downcast-target and location is needed afterall. that or allow intrinsic indicators to be multi-valued
        Specified by:
        getIncidentalSubclassIndicators in interface UsageDetails

        Specified by:

      • getReferencedNavigables

        public Collection<Navigable> getReferencedNavigables()
        Description copied from interface: UsageDetails
        All of the "sub" navigables referenced from the described SqmFrom. E.g., given the `SqmRoot(Person p)` I'd get for `"... from Person p..."`, and given the selection `"select p.id, p.name, p.age from Person p..."` - that SqmRoot would contain `EntityIdentifier(id), SingularAttribute(name), SingularAttribute(age)` as its `referencedNavigables`.
        Specified by:
        getReferencedNavigables in interface UsageDetails

      • usedInFromClause

        public void usedInFromClause()
        Description copied from interface: MutableUsageDetails
        Marks the SqmFrom as being "used" in the from-clause, although that really indicates that it was defined/created in the from-clause too
        Specified by:
        usedInFromClause in interface MutableUsageDetails

      • usedInSelectClause

        public void usedInSelectClause()
        Description copied from interface: MutableUsageDetails
        todo (6.0) : figure out how to best handle calling this -> is it enough to do it just for the actually selected NavigableReference? or should it be set for any of the "intermediate" NavigableReferences (joins) too? select o.customer from Order o select o.customer.shippingAddress from Order o In the first, clearly `o.customer` is "used in the select". But what about the second? Is `o.customer` "used in the select" here too? If so (and I think that is correct) then it cannot be as simple as calling it on the final navigable reference selected - it has to be called on all of its containers too. Anyway... how to best handle this...?
        Specified by:
        usedInSelectClause in interface MutableUsageDetails
